attributes.comment:
I am writing to comment on the USCIS proposal to raise the rates for filing an I-
600A form and biometrics. As part of a couple in the middle of adoption
paperwork, this is distressing news. The cost of international adoption is already
quite a burden, and I hope that these proposed rate increases will be
reconsidered. Specifically, we are adopting from China, and with its lengthy wait
process, we will have to file the I-600A and get fingerprinted not once, but twice,
so families in our situation would be doubly burdened by the increases. I can only
speak from the adoption perspective, and I realize that there are many other
groups who use this form and the biometrics service. The proposed rate increases
would serve only to further financially burden citizens.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Amy M. Kirtley-Hill
